You have a Microsoft 365 subscription that uses Microsoft Intune.

You need to ensure that you can deploy apps to Android Enterprise devices.

What should you do first?

You have a Microsoft 365 tenant that uses Microsoft Intune.

You use the Company Portal app to access and install published apps to enrolled devices.

From the Microsoft Intune admin center, you add a Microsoft Store app.

Which two App information types are visible in the Company Portal?

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

comments.content:

Exact link of the page for the correct answer

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
A. Privacy URL
B. Information URL

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/apps/store-apps-microsoft

Selected Answer: D
It seems I might be overlooking something. The question specifically refers to apps "visible in the Company Portal," not in the "Microsoft Store."

According to https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/user-help/manage-apps-cpweb#view-all-apps, the information visible includes the Name, Publisher, Date Published, Status, and Category.

Additionally, the app details page shows: Name, Publisher, "App Version", "Date Published", Categories, and "Device Management Required", as described in:
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/user-help/manage-apps-cpweb#view-app-details

So, it's possible that some of the previous answers are outdated.

Selected Answer: AB
AB is correct

Selected Answer: AB
In the New MS App Store type apps, I am seeing the Privacy URL prefilled but info URL being empty, same as Developer and Owner. In this, I'd go with Info URL option as Developer + Owner is something you'll always have to manually fill while Publisher comes pre-filled.

B and C

These details help users understand more about the app they are installing and who developed it. Privacy URL and Owner are not typically displayed in the Company Portal for Microsoft Store apps added to Intune.

Selected Answer: AB
Correct answer is AB.
Developer and Owner information is only visible in admin center.

These App information types are provided by the app developer. The Privacy URL links to the developer's privacy policy, and the Information URL links to the developer's website.

You have 200 computers that run Windows 10. The computers are joined to Azure AD and enrolled in Microsoft Intune.

You need to set a custom image as the wallpaper and sign-in screen.

Which two settings should you configure in the Device restrictions configuration profile? To answer, select the appropriate settings in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
As a gentle reminder, DO NOT TRUST Chat GPT. I see a lot of people here just providing ChatGPT answers instead of using their own brain and logic. 

Learn WHY the answer is correct. 
For this one, the setting is found in Devices > Windows > Configuration > Templates > Edition Upgrade and Mode Switch > Edition to upgrade to > choose Windows 10/11 Enterprise. 
This is why D is correct answer.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

D

With a device configuration profile in Intune, you can specify the Windows 11 Enterprise edition and initiate the upgrade process on the enrolled devices. This profile allows you to manage settings and configurations on devices, including initiating OS upgrades, ensuring a seamless transition to Windows 11 Enterprise.

ChatGPT: To upgrade computers from Windows 11 Pro to Windows 11 Enterprise managed by Microsoft Intune, you should configure a device configuration profile (option D). This profile will allow you to specify the settings and configurations needed for the upgrade process.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/configuration/edition-upgrade-configure-windows-10

configuration profile/Template/Edition upgrade and mode switch

Selected Answer: D
Create Windows 11 Enterprise Upgrade Profile:
In Microsoft Intune, create a Windows 11 Enterprise upgrade profile. This profile includes the details and settings for the upgrade. Here's a general outline of the steps:

In the Microsoft Endpoint Manager admin center, go to Devices > Windows > Configuration profiles.

comments.content: This is the key here: The computers are joined to Azure AD and enrolled in Microsoft Intune.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
device enrollment policy ?
Device Enrollment Policy (Option C):
A device enrollment policy in Microsoft Intune is used to control the enrollment of devices into Intune. It specifies the settings that are applied to a device during the enrollment process.
When you want to upgrade Windows editions or make other specific configurations during enrollment, you can use a device enrollment policy to target and configure those settings.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

questions.question_text:
You have computers that run Windows 11 Pro. The computers are joined to Azure AD and enrolled in Microsoft Intune.

You need to upgrade the computers to Windows 11 Enterprise.

What should you configure in Intune?

HOTSPOT -
All users have Microsoft 365 apps deployed.
You need to configure Microsoft 365 apps to meet the following requirements:
Enable the automatic installation of WebView2 Runtime.
Prevent users from submitting feedback.
Which two settings should you configure in the Microsoft 365 Apps admin center? To answer, select the appropriate settings in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
//IMG//

discussion.content:
Given answer is correct:
Enable the automatic installation of WebView2 Runtime > Device Configuration > Modern Apps Settings
Prevent users from submitting feedback > Policy management

Anwser is correct

You can enable automatic installation in the same setting as where you prevent it from being installed automatically:

To prevent the automatic installation of WebView2 Runtime, sign in to the Microsoft 365 Apps admin center (https://config.office.com) with an admin account. Then, go to Customization > Device Configuration > Modern Apps Settings. Select Microsoft Edge WebView2 and then clear the Enable automatic installation of WebView2 Runtime check box.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/deployoffice/webview2-install


Prevent users from submitting feedback:
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/admin/manage/manage-feedback-ms-org?view=o365-worldwide

No,You are mistake, WebView2 Runtime > Device Configuration > Modern Apps Settings, Prevent users from submitting feedback > Policy management
